title: NumPy: Understanding Array Shapes
story: Array shapes tell you the dimensions of your data. A 1D array has one dimension, a 2D array (matrix) has two.
instructions: Create a 2D array [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]] and print its shape. The shape should be (2, 3) meaning 2 rows and 3 columns.
starterCode:
import numpy as np

# Create 2D array and print shape
arr = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
print(arr.shape)
solutionHidden:
import numpy as np

arr = np.array([[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6]])
print(arr.shape)

tests.expectedBehavior: Print the shape of the 2D array

hints.text: Use .shape attribute to get the dimensions of an array.
A nested list becomes a 2D array. Each inner list is a row.
